issues.description: The problem statement (Part 2) incorrectly describes the callback parameter type for the PersonController methods as Consumer<List<Note>> (lines describe 'Each method takes a Consumer<List<Note>> parameter'). This conflicts with the actual method signatures in the template and solution, which use Consumer<List<Person>> for PersonController methods. This typo in the specification can confuse students about the expected generic type to use when implementing the client-side PersonController methods and may cause them to attempt to implement the wrong callback type.
issues.suggested_fix: Correct the problem statement so it refers to Consumer<List<Person>> (not Consumer<List<Note>>) when describing the PersonController callback parameter. This aligns the textual specification with the template and solution and avoids confusion when students implement the PersonController methods.
